subs.text: Journalism is self-governing. Responsible to no one but itself. Journalism is its own journalism, and not surprisingly that means no journalism. Imagine any other industry or organization that could make sure it never gets bad press. That is the problem with journalism.

subs.text: Now is a time for news sources that might be cut off to start using RSS seriously because that would allow others to mirror their content, and make it possible to get it back online with just a DNS change.
subs.rawText: Now is a time for news sources that might be cut off to start using RSS seriously because that would allow others to mirror their content, and make it possible to get it back online with just a DNS change.

subs.text: People thought we were being too idealistic when it was said that a benefit of syndication is that it helps route around censorship. Now in 2022, that's a very real thing. Such an inexpensive insurance policy to help make sure the news gets out.
subs.rawText: People thought we were being too idealistic when it was said that a benefit of syndication is that it helps route around censorship. Now in 2022, that's a very real thing. Such an inexpensive insurance policy to help make sure the news gets out.

subs.text: Once a long time ago I went to Microsoft with a plan to bring podcasting to all their users. What came from that meeting was typical corporate CYA, had nothing to do with the idea, which would have empowered users, but instead made them consumers of sanitized programming.
subs.rawText: Once a long time ago I went to Microsoft with a plan to bring podcasting to all their users. What came from that meeting was typical corporate CYA, had nothing to do with the idea, which would have empowered users, but instead made them consumers of sanitized programming.

subs.text: Nothing came of it of course, except now 18 years later Spotify et al are doing the same bullshit and calling it podcasting. Ultimately it may make some money for them, but it won’t further the cause. Pointless.
subs.rawText: Nothing came of it of course, except now 18 years later Spotify et al are doing the same bullshit and calling it podcasting. Ultimately it may make some money for them, but it won’t further the cause. Pointless.

subs.text: We need to create systems of governance that really empower the people, not try to con them into a safe sanitized feeling of power. As a child of the 60s I still have the dream, but I don’t think many of my generation remember.
subs.rawText: We need to create systems of governance that really empower the people, not try to con them into a safe sanitized feeling of power. As a child of the 60s I still have the dream, but I don’t think many of my generation remember.

subs.text: Nothing short of total freedom to create for the people is enough or will work.
subs.rawText: Nothing short of total freedom to create for the people is enough or will work.

subs.text: 1/3 Hillary Clinton was interviewed on Maddow the other night. She said the crypto companies weren't cooperating in freezing accounts of Russians. She said it was some form of libertarian idealism, don't remember her exact words, but I do remember the tone -- sneering.
subs.rawText: 1/3 Hillary Clinton was interviewed on Maddow the other night. She said the crypto companies weren't cooperating in freezing accounts of Russians. She said it was some form of libertarian idealism, don't remember her exact words, but I do remember the tone -- sneering.

subs.text: 2/3 I think she got it wrong though, the accounts are anonymous, so they can't block Russians because they have no way of knowing who is Russian.
subs.rawText: 2/3 I think she got it wrong though, the accounts are anonymous, so they can't block Russians because they have no way of knowing who is Russian.

subs.text: 3/3 Then I heard a report on NPR just now, where they used the same terminology, without the sneering. So I wonder who got the wrong idea from whom?
subs.rawText: 3/3 Then I heard a report on NPR just now, where they used the same terminology, without the sneering. So I wonder who got the wrong idea from whom?

subs.text: And btw, it was HRC's naivete about tech that lost her the 2016 election, and led to the chaos of Trump as president. I tend to blame the journalists for being too stupid about tech to understand the supposed crime, but they didn't defend themselves either.

subs.text:
@sarahkendzior @gaslitnation I think basically he's winding the clock back to the Cuban Missile Crisis and insisting we play it out again. 

He thinks that will result in him achieving his goal. I think so too, and I think Biden does as well. That's why the demands for a no-fly zone are crazy.

subs.text:
Imagine a peace conference in a few weeks, with the Ukraine and Russia, the EU, NATO and of course the US. 

One thing the US wants is to be sure Russia stays out of our elections in the future, maybe some reparations for the damage they did in 2016. 

That has not been settled.
subs.rawText:

subs.text:
I never thought to look until just now but..

Alexa has an audio-out mini jack.

I have a pair of Audioengine speakers not in use. 

Voila -- Amazon Music with some real sound. 

I'm giving it to my Peloton.

BTW, did my 100th ride yesterday.

You could say I'm hooked.

subs.text: BTW #toolsforthought people, my OPML-based search engine, Daytona, can give me all my blocks that ref Peloton, in an outline. [link] I did not have to enter [[Peloton]] to be able to access it this way. This has been a revelation.
subs.rawText:

subs.text: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.
subs.rawText: @jeffjarvis I took a political science in college, was thinking of being a major. When they got around to polling, what was made clear was you could get people to say whatever you want by how you asked the question.

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis For example if they asked this question.

1. Do you think Americans should support the president in times of war, regardless of party? 

And then..

2. Do you approve of how President Biden is handling the war in Ukraine?

You'd get the patriotic answer inside every American.
subs.rawText:
@jeffjarvis For example if they asked this question.
